rows.name: No Bake Strawberry Cheesecake Dessert

instructions.text: Combine graham cracker crumbs, Truvia and melted coconut oil. Firmly press mixture into the bottom of a 9x9-inch pan.
In a bowl, whisk together yogurt and pudding mix until smooth. Spread on top of graham cracker crust.
In a separate bowl, combine sliced strawberries and glaze then spread on top.
Refrigerate until serving.

instructions_flat.text: Combine graham cracker crumbs, Truvia and melted coconut oil. Firmly press mixture into the bottom of a 9x9-inch pan.
In a bowl, whisk together yogurt and pudding mix until smooth. Spread on top of graham cracker crust.
In a separate bowl, combine sliced strawberries and glaze then spread on top.
Refrigerate until serving.

rows.notes:
Serving size - 4.9 ounces

MFF No Bake Strawberry Cheesecake Dessert

January 2020

parent_post.post_content:
No Bake Strawberry Cheesecake Dessert

  • 1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
  • 2 Tablespoons Truvia Cane Sugar Blend
  • 5 Tablespoons coconut oil (melted)
  • 2 cups nonfat vanilla Greek yogurt
  • 2 Tablespoons Sugar-Free Jello Cheesecake Pudding Mix
  • 16 ounces strawberries (sliced)
  • 1/2 cup sugar-free strawberry glaze
  1. Combine graham cracker crumbs, Truvia and melted coconut oil. Firmly press mixture into the bottom of a 9x9-inch pan.
  2. In a bowl, whisk together yogurt and pudding mix until smooth. Spread on top of graham cracker crust.
  3. In a separate bowl, combine sliced strawberries and glaze then spread on top.
  4. Refrigerate until serving.

Serving size - 1/9 of recipe - 1 piece.

MFF No Bake Strawberry Cheesecake Dessert

January 2020

Dessert, Snack

ingredients.name: Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips

instructions.text: In a saucepan over medium heat, whisk together peanut butter and coconut oil until completely smooth and melted.
Remove from heat, mix in honey and vanilla extract. Add chocolate chips and stir until melted.
Mix in protein powder, collagen peptides and quick oats until well combined.
Using a cookie scoop, or two spoons, drop mixture onto a lined baking sheet and place in the refrigerator for 20-30 minutes, or until set up.

ingredients_flat.name: Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips

instructions_flat.text: In a saucepan over medium heat, whisk together peanut butter and coconut oil until completely smooth and melted.
Remove from heat, mix in honey and vanilla extract. Add chocolate chips and stir until melted.
Mix in protein powder, collagen peptides and quick oats until well combined.
Using a cookie scoop, or two spoons, drop mixture onto a lined baking sheet and place in the refrigerator for 20-30 minutes, or until set up.

parent_post.post_content:
Protein No Bake Cookies

  • 1 cup natural peanut butter
  • 1/2 cup coconut oil
  • 1/2 cup honey
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1 cup Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips
  • 2 (25 gram) scoops chocolate protein powder
  • 2 (10 gram) scoops Vital Proteins Unflavored Collagen Peptides
  • 2 1/2 cups quick oats

  1. In a saucepan over medium heat, whisk together peanut butter and coconut oil until completely smooth and melted.

  2. Remove from heat, mix in honey and vanilla extract. Add chocolate chips and stir until melted.

  3. Mix in protein powder, collagen peptides and quick oats until well combined.

  4. Using a cookie scoop, or two spoons, drop mixture onto a lined baking sheet and place in the refrigerator for 20-30 minutes, or until set up.

Snack
American
macro friendly,, macros, protein, treat

rows.name: No Bake Peanut Butter Cups

ingredients.name: Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips

instructions.text: Fill a muffin tin with cupcake liners; set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, flaxseed, protein powder, collagen, vanilla, coconut oil and honey. Divide mixture evenly between muffin cups and press down with a spoon.
Place chocolate chips in a small bowl, microwave for 2 minutes and stir until completely smooth. Divide chocolate evenly between each cup and spread with a spoon.
Refrigerate until chocolate is set up.

ingredients_flat.name: Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips

instructions_flat.text: Fill a muffin tin with cupcake liners; set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, flaxseed, protein powder, collagen, vanilla, coconut oil and honey. Divide mixture evenly between muffin cups and press down with a spoon.
Place chocolate chips in a small bowl, microwave for 2 minutes and stir until completely smooth. Divide chocolate evenly between each cup and spread with a spoon.
Refrigerate until chocolate is set up.

rows.notes:
Serving size - 1/12 of recipe - 1 cup

MFP: MFF No Bake Peanut Butter Cups

January 2020

parent_post.post_content:
No Bake Peanut Butter Cups

  • 1 cup natural peanut butter
  • 3/4 cup ground flaxseed
  • 2 (25 gram) scoops vanilla protein powder
  • 2 (10 gram) scoops Vital Proteins Unflavored Collagen Peptides
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 Tablespoon coconut oil (melted)
  • 1/2 cup honey
  • 3/4 cup Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips
  1. Fill a muffin tin with cupcake liners; set aside.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, flaxseed, protein powder, collagen, vanilla, coconut oil and honey. Divide mixture evenly between muffin cups and press down with a spoon.
  3. Place chocolate chips in a small bowl, microwave for 2 minutes and stir until completely smooth. Divide chocolate evenly between each cup and spread with a spoon.
  4. Refrigerate until chocolate is set up.

Serving size - 1/12 of recipe - 1 cup

MFP: MFF No Bake Peanut Butter Cups

January 2020

Dessert, Snack

instructions.text: In a large bowl or stand mixer, combine all ingredients until well combined.
Line a 9x13-inch baking pan with wax paper. Press dough in an even layer in prepared pan.
Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Cut into 12 bars. Store bars in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

parent_post.post_content:
Peanut Butter Coconut Chocolate Protein Bars

  • 1 cup natural peanut butter
  • 2 Tablespoons coconut oil (melted)
  • 1/4 cup honey
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 4 (10 gram) scoops Vital Proteins Unflavored Collagen Peptides
  • 4 (25 gram) scoops vanilla protein powder
  • 1/4 cup ground flaxseed
  • 1/4 cup unsweetened coconut flakes
  • 1/4 cup Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips
  1. In a large bowl or stand mixer, combine all ingredients until well combined.
  2. Line a 9x13-inch baking pan with wax paper. Press dough in an even layer in prepared pan.
  3. Refrigerate for 1 hour.
  4. Cut into 12 bars. Store bars in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

Serving size - 1/12 of recipe - 1 bar

rows.name: Zucchini Bread

ingredients.name: zucchini
ingredients.notes: grated; squeeze out excess moisture using a paper towel

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.

In a large mixing bowl, whisk together melted coconut oil and honey. Mix in eggs, vanilla, salt, milk and zucchini until well combined. Fold in collagen, protein powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and flour.
Spray a 9X5-inch bread pan with nonstick cooking spray and pour in batter. Mix together remaining cinnamon and Truvia and sprinkle on top.
Bake for 50-55 minutes, or until golden brown on top and set in the center. Cut into slices and serve.

ingredients_flat.name: zucchini
ingredients_flat.notes: grated; squeeze out excess moisture using a paper towel

instructions_flat.text: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.

In a large mixing bowl, whisk together melted coconut oil and honey. Mix in eggs, vanilla, salt, milk and zucchini until well combined. Fold in collagen, protein powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and flour.
Spray a 9X5-inch bread pan with nonstick cooking spray and pour in batter. Mix together remaining cinnamon and Truvia and sprinkle on top.
Bake for 50-55 minutes, or until golden brown on top and set in the center. Cut into slices and serve.

rows.notes:
Serving size - 1/10 of recipe - 1 slice

MFP: MFF Zucchini Bread

January 2020

parent_post.post_content:
Zucchini Bread

Bread

  • 1/3 cup coconut oil (melted)
  • 1/2 cup honey
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1 3/4 cups low-fat 1% milk
  • 1 3/4 cup zucchini (grated; squeeze out excess moisture using a paper towel)
  • 2 (10 gram) scoops Vital Proteins Unflavored Collagen Peptides
  • 2 (25 gram) scoops vanilla protein powder
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour

Topping

  • 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon Truvia Cane Sugar Blend
  1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together melted coconut oil and honey. Mix in eggs, vanilla, salt, milk and zucchini until well combined. Fold in collagen, protein powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and flour.
  3. Spray a 9X5-inch bread pan with nonstick cooking spray and pour in batter. Mix together remaining cinnamon and Truvia and sprinkle on top.
  4. Bake for 50-55 minutes, or until golden brown on top and set in the center. Cut into slices and serve.

Serving size - 1/10 of recipe - 1 slice

MFP: MFF Zucchini Bread

January 2020

Snack

rows.name: Muddy Buddies

ingredients.name: Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips

instructions.text: Measure cereal and place in a large mixing bowl; set aside.
Pour powdered sugar, protein powder and collagen into a gallon-sized resealable bag; seal and shake to combine.

In a microwave safe bowl, add chocolate chips, peanut butter and coconut oil and microwave for 2 minutes, stirring halfway through. Stir until chocolate chips have melted and mixture is smooth. Pour over cereal and toss to coat.
Carefully pour coated cereal mixture into the bag, seal and shake until completely coated.
Spread on parchment paper to cool, if desired.

ingredients_flat.name: Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips

instructions_flat.text: Measure cereal and place in a large mixing bowl; set aside.
Pour powdered sugar, protein powder and collagen into a gallon-sized resealable bag; seal and shake to combine.

In a microwave safe bowl, add chocolate chips, peanut butter and coconut oil and microwave for 2 minutes, stirring halfway through. Stir until chocolate chips have melted and mixture is smooth. Pour over cereal and toss to coat.
Carefully pour coated cereal mixture into the bag, seal and shake until completely coated.
Spread on parchment paper to cool, if desired.

rows.notes:
Serving size - 1/2 cup

MFP: MFF Muddy Buddies

January 2020

parent_post.post_content:
Muddy Buddies

  • 6 cups Rice Chex Cereal
  • 3/4 cup powdered sugar
  • 1 (25 gram) scoop vanilla protein powder
  • 2 (10 gram) scoops Vital Proteins Unflavored Collagen Peptides
  • 2/3 cup Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips
  • 1/3 cup natural peanut butter
  • 1 Tablespoon coconut oil
  1. Measure cereal and place in a large mixing bowl; set aside.
  2. Pour powdered sugar, protein powder and collagen into a gallon-sized resealable bag; seal and shake to combine.
  3. In a microwave safe bowl, add chocolate chips, peanut butter and coconut oil and microwave for 2 minutes, stirring halfway through. Stir until chocolate chips have melted and mixture is smooth. Pour over cereal and toss to coat.

  4. Carefully pour coated cereal mixture into the bag, seal and shake until completely coated.

  5. Spread on parchment paper to cool, if desired.

Serving size - 1/2 cup

MFP: MFF Muddy Buddies

January 2020

Dessert, Snack

rows.name: Scotcheroos

ingredients.name: Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, maple syrup, honey, protein powder and salt. Fold in rice cereal until well combined.
Line an 8x8-inch pan with wax paper and press cereal mixture firmly into the bottom of the pan.
Place chocolate chips in a small bowl and microwave for 2 minutes then stir until smooth. Spread melted chocolate on top of the cereal layer and place in the refrigerator until set up.
Remove from pan and cut into 16 bars.

ingredients_flat.name: Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips

instructions_flat.text: In a large mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, maple syrup, honey, protein powder and salt. Fold in rice cereal until well combined.
Line an 8x8-inch pan with wax paper and press cereal mixture firmly into the bottom of the pan.
Place chocolate chips in a small bowl and microwave for 2 minutes then stir until smooth. Spread melted chocolate on top of the cereal layer and place in the refrigerator until set up.
Remove from pan and cut into 16 bars.

rows.notes:
Serving size - 1/16 recipe - 1 bar

MFP: MFF Scotcheroos

January 2020

parent_post.post_content:
Scotcheroos

  • 3/4 cup natural peanut butter
  • 3/4 cup pure maple syrup
  • 1/4 cup honey
  • 2 (25 gram) scoops vanilla protein powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 5 cups Rice Krispie cereal
  • 1 cup Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips
  1. In a large mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, maple syrup, honey, protein powder and salt. Fold in rice cereal until well combined.
  2. Line an 8x8-inch pan with wax paper and press cereal mixture firmly into the bottom of the pan.
  3. Place chocolate chips in a small bowl and microwave for 2 minutes then stir until smooth. Spread melted chocolate on top of the cereal layer and place in the refrigerator until set up.
  4. Remove from pan and cut into 16 bars.

Serving size - 1/16 recipe - 1 bar

MFP: MFF Scotcheroos

January 2020

Dessert, Snack

rows.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies

ingredients.name: Kodiak Cakes Buttermilk Power Cakes Mix
Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, combine honey, coconut oil, eggs, pumpkin, and vanilla extract.
Add collagen, protein powder, Kodiak Cakes, baking soda, and salt. Mix until well combined. Fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop onto a baking sheet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray.Bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.

ingredients_flat.name: Kodiak Cakes Buttermilk Power Cakes Mix
Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips

instructions_flat.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, combine honey, coconut oil, eggs, pumpkin, and vanilla extract.
Add collagen, protein powder, Kodiak Cakes, baking soda, and salt. Mix until well combined. Fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop onto a baking sheet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray.Bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.

MFP: MFF Chocolate Chip Cookies

January 2020

parent_post.post_content:
Chocolate Chip Cookies

  • 1/3 cup honey
  • 1/4 cup coconut oil (melted)
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 Tablespoons pumpkin purée
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 (10 gram) scoops Vital Proteins Unflavored Collagen Peptides
  • 2 (25 gram) scoops scoops vanilla protein powder
  • 2 cups Kodiak Cakes Buttermilk Power Cakes Mix
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup Enjoy Life Mini Dark Chocolate Chips
  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.

  2. In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer, combine honey, coconut oil, eggs, pumpkin, and vanilla extract.

  3. Add collagen, protein powder, Kodiak Cakes, baking soda, and salt. Mix until well combined. Fold in chocolate chips.

  4. Scoop onto a baking sheet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray.Bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.

Serving size: 1 cookie (approximately 1 ounce)

MFP: MFF Chocolate Chip Cookies

January 2020

Dessert, Snack
